identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

abstract.p: Unemployment in the 11 European Union countries that have adopted euro as single currency drops to 9.1 percent in June, its lowest level in almost eight years, from 9.2 in May (S)

block.p: As Europe's expanding economy encouraged businesses to hire more people, unemployment in the 11 countries that adopted the euro as a single currency last year dropped to 9.1 percent in June, its lowest level in almost eight years, from 9.2 percent in May. The group includes Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Austria, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Finland and Sweden. Among them, Spain had the highest unemployment, at 14.1 percent, while Luxembourg, with 2.2 percent, and Austria, with 3.3 percent, had the lowest unemployment rates.

As Europe's expanding economy encouraged businesses to hire more people, unemployment in the 11 countries that adopted the euro as a single currency last year dropped to 9.1 percent in June, its lowest level in almost eight years, from 9.2 percent in May. The group includes Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Austria, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Finland and Sweden. Among them, Spain had the highest unemployment, at 14.1 percent, while Luxembourg, with 2.2 percent, and Austria, with 3.3 percent, had the lowest unemployment rates.
